author: Aris Folley
description: Republicans are divided as they try to chart a plan to keep the government open past the end of the month, with just 12 legislative days until funding runs out. Top Republican appropriators are pushing for a short-term funding patch that lasts into November to buy time for Congress to strike a larger bipartisan deal…
title: Republicans divided on stopgap strategy to prevent looming shutdown

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration is targeting another offshore wind project, the latest in a string of wind farms whose approvals it plans to cancel. In a Wednesday court filing the administration indicated it plans to vacate and reconsider the approval of the New England Wind 1 and 2 projects. The filing does not give a reason why it…
title: Trump targets another offshore wind project

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Amazon is ending its Prime Invitee program, which has allowed members to share their free shipping benefit with a select number of users outside their household. The company announced this week that it’s replacing the program with Amazon Family, which will allow members to share a variety of Prime benefits with one other adult in…
title: Amazon ending Prime free shipping sharing

author: Alex Gangitano
description: Vice President Vance on Wednesday said there are “no immediate” plans to send the National Guard to Chicago in an effort to curb crime after President Trump has flirted with the idea for weeks. The vice president was asked how many members of the National Guard would be sent to the Windy City and when…
title: Vance says ‘no immediate’ plans to send National Guard to Chicago

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping were caught on a hot mic discussing organ transplants and immortality at the military parade in Beijing on Wednesday.  The two leaders were captured on the stream as they walked with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un at Tiananmen Square, with the Russian translator saying: “Biotechnology…
title: Putin, Xi caught on hot mic discussing organ transplants and immortality

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: A new poll suggests that few Americans trust Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s medical advice, with 48% of respondents distrusting him and 79% trusting their own doctors.
title: 1 in 4 Americans trust RFK Jr. with medical advice

description: New Jersey gubernatorial candidates Jack Ciattarelli and Rep. Phil Murphy (D) four years ago, is seeking to pull off…

description: Several Republicans joined House Democrats on Wednesday to kill a GOP effort to censure Rep. LaMonica McIver (D-N.J.) over a chaotic scrum with law enforcement that unfolded as a group of officials attempted to tour a detention center and immigration agents arrested the Newark mayor. A Democratic effort to table the censure motion was approved…

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: Democrats need to focus on gun trafficking and mental health restrictions, rather than gun bans, in order to reduce gun violence and break the political deadlock.
title: Democrats need to drop calling for gun bans and ask these two questions

description: The Powerball jackpot increased to a whopping $1.4 billion for Wednesday night’s drawing — the fourth largest in its history and the sixth largest ever among all U.S. lotteries. While the chances of striking big are notoriously slim, even a lucky jackpot winner should not expect to walk away a billionaire any time soon. In…

author: The Hill Staff
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) will honor the African American men of the 369th Infantry Regiment on Wednesday afternoon during a Congressional Gold Medal ceremony. The fighters, known as the “Harlem Hellfighters,” were known for their service in World War I. They gained recognition as the unit assigned to fight under the 16th Division of the…

description: Paul Offit, a pediatrician and vaccine expert who has often criticized health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., has been blocked from serving on a Food and Drug Administration (FDA) vaccine advisory panel.  According to a spokesperson for the Department of Health and Human Services, Offit was among several FDA advisory committee members whose Special Government…

author: Emily Brooks
description: House Republicans voted on Wednesday to authorize a select subcommittee to investigate the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack and potentially the previous Democratic-run Jan. 6 committee, a move that came more than seven months after the panel was first announced. The subcommittee will be part of the House Judiciary Committee and will be chaired by…

description: "It's really healthy to open up a discussion, an honest scientific discussion, uncensored, on the evidence on the COVID-19 vaccine."

author: Robert E. May, opinion contributor
description: Trump's call to downplay the horrors of slavery is a red flag moment, as evidenced by the microhistory of Christmas on plantations, which reveals the continued physical and verbal abuse, slave trading and other horrors of slavery during the holiday season.

description: President Trump on Wednesday predicted that Republicans can extend government funding, as Congress races to avert a government shutdown by Sept. 30. “Yeah, I do,” he said when asked if he thinks a shutdown can be avoided. “I think the Republicans will vote for an extension.” He then in turn railed against Democrats, arguing that he…

In a 2-1 ruling, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit said commissioner Rebecca Slaughter, who was appointed to the Democratic seat in 2018, was wrongfully removed from…

author: Diana Ohlbaum, opinion contributor
description: These are not ordinary times. It’s not just that the Trump administration is taking actions that horrify and offend us. It’s that in just seven months, President Trump has all but dismantled a democratic system that took more than 200 years to build. He and his team have failed to comply with nearly a third of major…

author: Tobias Burns
description: The number of job openings decreased by more in July than economists were expecting as the labor market recalibrates in response to President Trump’s trade war and immigration crackdown. Open jobs in the monthly JOLTS survey fell to a rounded 7.2 million, down from 7.4 million in June, the Labor Department reported Wednesday. Economic forecasts…

The top priorities for the joint effort will including homelessness and encampments, beautification, and finance and economic resilience, according to a release from Bowser’s office. The…

description: Foreigners rightly object to the tariffs on their country and on the prospect of arbitrary immigration and border enforcement, which hurts businesses in our own tourism industry.

I just assume we’ll get the votes,” Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) told…

description: Senate Republicans are zeroing in on a rule change, which would be enacted through the “nuclear option,” that would allow them to expeditiously confirm scores of President Trump’s executive branch and judicial nominees. The Republicans are hoping to move quickly and home in on a plan on Wednesday, when they convene for a special conference…
